meanings.definition: Pietism: a movement in the Lutheran Church emphasizing personal piety and devotion.
meanings.sent1: The pietism of the church members was evident in their daily prayers and acts of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The history books often mention pietism as a significant aspect of Lutheran beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The pietism of the congregation led to a friendly competition of who could donate the most to charity.
meanings.sent4: Her pietism shone like a beacon of light in the community, inspiring others to be more compassionate.
meanings.sent5: The image of pietism was painted vividly in the stories shared by the elders.

meanings.definition: Pietism: the principles and practices of the Pietists.
meanings.sent1: Studying the pietism of the Pietists helped me understand their beliefs better.
meanings.sent2: The library had a section dedicated to books on pietism and its followers.
meanings.sent3: The pietism of the Pietists was so strict that they even had rules about how to dress.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, his pietism was like a symphony of devotion and faith.
meanings.sent5: The essence of pietism lingered in the air, creating an atmosphere of reverence.
